title: SonarQube Complete Course
description: Master SonarQube for code quality, static analysis, metrics, and integration with CI pipelines.

subtopics.title: What is SonarQube?
subtopics.content: SonarQube is an open-source platform for continuous inspection of code quality. It performs static code analysis to detect bugs, code smells, and security vulnerabilities in over 25 programming languages.

subtopics.title: Installing SonarQube
subtopics.content: Download SonarQube from the official site and extract it. Start the server with the provided script (Windows: StartSonar.bat, Linux: sonar.sh). Access the dashboard at http://localhost:9000.

subtopics.title: Analyzing Projects
subtopics.content:
Install and configure a SonarQube scanner (CLI, Maven, Gradle, etc.). Run analysis with project-specific configuration. Example CLI:
```
sonar-scanner \
  -Dsonar.projectKey=myproject \
  -Dsonar.sources=. \
  -Dsonar.host.url=http://localhost:9000 \
  -Dsonar.login=your_token
```

subtopics.title: Quality Profiles and Gates
subtopics.content: Quality Profiles define rules for analysis. Quality Gates enforce standards (e.g., no critical issues allowed) before merging or releasing.

subtopics.title: SonarQube Metrics
subtopics.content:
- Bugs: Defects that could lead to errors
- Vulnerabilities: Security risks
- Code Smells: Maintainability issues
- Coverage: Test coverage percent
- Duplications: Duplicate code blocks

subtopics.title: Integrating with CI/CD
subtopics.content: SonarQube can be integrated into Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and others to automatically analyze code during pipelines.

subtopics.title: Security Analysis
subtopics.content: SonarQube detects security hotspots and vulnerabilities, helping teams address OWASP Top 10 risks and comply with standards.

subtopics.title: SonarQube Best Practices
subtopics.content:
- Regularly update rules and plugins
- Analyze code on every commit
- Set up notifications for new issues
- Use badges for project dashboards
